title: (x) Appalachia script - Ballantines {Dav}
content:
Does this font look familiar? The A seems unique, its throwing me off.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [appalachia.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604065048/http:/typophile.com/files/appalachia.gif) | 106.67 KB |
author: evan

comments.content:
There is a _( ‘free’ )_ font ‘out there’, named ‘Alison’, which is similar..

_( Edit-A-Bit.: Hah, While searching the mighty ‘Typophile Archives’ I found that I actually posted an almost identical sentence to the one above, more than a year ago.: [typophile.com/node/7473](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604065048/http:/typophile.com/node/7473) :) Please note that some parts and posts within that thread are missing.. )_

‘Alison’ / ‘Dianna’ / ‘ [Ballantines](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604065048/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1129&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=EFT0000026)’  
_( ‘ [Ballantines](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604065048/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1129&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=EFT0000026)’ seems to be the base ‘source’, for all these, even custimized, ‘bootlegs’.. )_

Dav
Alison - pretty darn close. The A is quite unique compared to Ballantines.
